data.title: Mohtarma Benazir Bhutto and Ors. vs. President of Pakistan and Ors.
data.meta_description: In this case, the Supreme Court of Pakistan (“Court”) determined the validity of the use of telephone tapping and eavesdropping in the context of the right to privacy guaranteed by article 14 of the Constitution. The Court observed that the Constitution was to be read in a liberal and beneficial manner in order to incorporate the fundamental rights guaranteed by the Constitution. It noted that ‘dignity of man’ and ‘privacy of home’ under Article 14 of the Constitution was inviolable.
